definition: separated by a generation/a lifetime ago
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble
surname Shi
like a thing of the previous generation/as if it were a lifetime ago
see 恍如隔世[huang3 ru2 ge2 shi4]

sentences.english: That a separate the world empty thoughts, like poison, always let a person willing to sink.
sentences.chinese: 那一份隔世離空的思念，宛如毒藥，總讓人甘願沉淪。

sentences.english: The mist was scattered over the mountain by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 雲氣漫山，隨風四散，恍如隔世。

sentences.english: Paul showed he was out of touch with the modern world.
sentences.chinese: 保羅好像與現代社會恍如隔世。

sentences.english: Suddenly in my eyes London resembles Chengdu, my dear hometown in a distance of age.
sentences.chinese: 突然覺得倫敦很像成都，我恍如隔世的故鄉。

definition: see 恍如隔世[huang3 ru2 ge2 shi4]
like a thing of the previous generation/as if it were a lifetime ago
so close, yet worlds apart (idiom)
the past/impurity contracted previously (in the sentient world) (Buddhism)
quiet, silent, and lonely/far and indistinct/gone without a trace
this mortal life/the mundane world
to be as if.../to be rather like...
fantasy/illusion/dream
in a dream
a long period of separation
engraved in one's heart and carved in one's bones (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
old dreams
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
distantly remote/also written 邈遠|邈远[miao3 yuan3]
frustrated/perplexed/irresolute/dazed
